wtsproc.config: Transmission removed (pull-type clutch); clutch caddie used.

step1.para: Prior to clutch removal, install a clutch disc aligning tool to the driven disc and release bearing assembly.
Install two 5/8-inch wooden blocks between the clutch release bearing housing and the clutch flywheel ring.

note.para: The wooden spacers relieve the heavy internal spring load in the clutch assembly.

step1.para: Install clutch caddie to clutch disc aligning tool.
Loosen the clutch retaining bolts in a criss-cross pattern.

note.para: This is done to prevent cocking and binding within the clutch.

step1.para: When all bolts have been removed, slide the clutch assembly back and off.
Inspect clutch flywheel and clutch flywheel housing for runout.
Install a new pilot bearing in the flywheel. If the old bearing is to be re-used, it must be cleaned and checked thoroughly.
Install the front-driving disc assembly in the flywheel with the side stamped "flywheel" facing the engine.
Install the intermediate plate in the flywheel, locating the drive slots on the drive pins.

note.para: If equipped with flat flywheel, use guide bolts.

step1.para: Install three anti-rattle springs equally spaced between drive pins. Install with the curved side of the hole toward the flywheel face.

warning.para: Wear heavy gloves when installing anti-rattle springs. They have sharp edges.

step1.para: Insert the clutch disc aligning tool through the hub of the rear driven disc with the side stamped "pressure plate" facing the transmission. Insert the aligning tool through the hub of the front driven disc and into the pilot bearing.
Position the pressure plate assembly on the flywheel with the lock strap (wear compensator assembly) aligned with the opening in the bell housing.
Install clutch retaining bolts progressively in a criss-cross pattern to pull the clutch ring into its proper position in the pilot bearing.

note.para: See CTS-5000 for the proper sequence pattern of the clutch retaining bolts.

step1.para: Torque clutch retaining bolts to specifications.
As the clutch retaining bolts are tightened, the wood blocks should fall free. If they do not fall free, be sure to remove them.
After entire job is performed, remove wheel chocks.
